title: Level 4: Prime Factorization
description:
Every composite number can be expressed as a unique product of prime numbers - this is called prime factorization.

For example: 60 = 2 × 2 × 3 × 5

Find the prime factorization of: {{input}}

What is the sum of all the prime factors (counting duplicates)?

For example, for 60: 2 + 2 + 3 + 5 = 12
hint: Divide by the smallest prime (2) as many times as possible, then try 3, then 5, and so on. Keep track of all prime factors and sum them.
